remarks.para: May be inoperative provided the compressor overheat discharge switches are operative.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:

placard.para: Placard adjacent to the associated Pack switch "COMP TEMP BULB(s) INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Ensure compressor discharge overheat switches are operative by accomplishing the following test:
Open PACK TEMP CONTROL A (C10217) and PACK TEMP CONTROL B (C10218) circuit breakers on the P6 Main Power Distribution Panel.
Supply electrical power.
Make sure the applicable (1, 2 or 3) PACKS selector, on the overhead panel, P5, is in the NORM position.
Make sure the EICAS message system operates normally.
Push the ECS switch on the EICAS display select panel.
Open the applicable air conditioning access doors (191A, 191H or 192A).
Disconnect the applicable electrical connector from the compressor discharge overheat switch:
– DS520 for pack 1
– DS517 for pack 2
– DS522 for pack 3
Install a jumper wire between pin 1 and pin 2 of the electrical connector.
Make sure the SYS FAULT light on the applicable PACK RST switch on the P5 panel comes on.
Remove the jumper wire from the electrical connector.
Reconnect the applicable electrical connector to the compressor discharge overheat switch:
– DS520 for pack 1
– DS517 for pack 2
– DS522 for pack 3
Make sure that the SYS FAULT light goes off when you push the PACK RST switch.
Close air conditioning access doors, push in PACK TEMP CONTROL A (C10217) and PACK TEMP CONTROL B (C10218) circuit breakers and restore aircraft back to normal configuration.
